intro: Agrostemma thessalum, commonly known as the Thessalian goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale yellow or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and along roadsides. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Agrostemma thessalum is an annual herb that completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
